contextId.information: The implied information can be stated explicitly. AT: "a different doctrine from what we teach" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It can be made explicit that this was the testimony that God wants to save all people. AT: "as the proof at the right time that God wants to save all people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: as the testimony at the right time

contextId.information: The implied meaning may be stated explicitly. AT: "a good reputation among other believers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is implied that they will forbid believers to marry. AT: "forbid believers to marry" or "prevent believers from marrying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It is implied that they will forbid only certain foods. AT: "and they will require believers to abstain from certain foods" or "and they will not allow people to eat certain foods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

It is implied that Paul means Timothy should not drink only water. He is telling Timothy to use wine as medicine. The water in that area often caused sickness. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You should no longer drink water

contextId.information: "in the presence of God." It is implied that Paul as asking God to be his witness. AT: "with God as a witness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
It is implied that God will reveal Jesus. AT: "God will reveal Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
